q: In Windows, you are setting up the KDNET Network Kernel Debugging automatically. If the debugger times out and does not connect, then which of the following Console code is used to verify the connectivity?
You are working with the Kernel-mode debugging. Which of the following types of cables are supported by the Windows debuggers?

You are working with the media player in UWP. Which of the following statements about the MediaPlayerElement class are correct:
1) It is a XAML control that serves as a rendering surface for the robust MediaPlayer class that is a part of Windows.Media.MediaPlayback namespace.
2) The SetMediaPlayer method is used to change the underlying MediaPlayer class for an instance of the MediaPlayerElement class.
3) The DisplayRequest.RequestActive method is called to prevent the display from being deactivated when the MediaPlayerElement class is not in full-window mode.
In Windows, which of the following allows administrators to specify and enforce application trust boundaries by limiting the scope where application services can act on the behalf of a user?
In Windows, which of the following is a challenge-response style authentication protocol and also provides the feature of session security?

In Windows, what are the characteristics of the Datacenter Firewall:

  1. It is a network layer.
  2. It is a 3-tuple firewall.
  3. It is a stateful firewall.
  4. It is a multitenant firewall.

In Windows, which of the following governances can perform these actions to remove detected threats:

  • Inherit parent folder permissions
  • Make a file or folder private
  • Put a file or folder in admin quarantine
  • Put a file or folder in user quarantine
In Windows, which of the following is directly integrated with the audit logs of Office 365 to receive all audited events from all supported services such as PowerApps, Forms, Sway, and Stream?

In Windows, which of the following integrations in the mobility of virtual machines enable a number of new scenarios for the optimization of resources in private cloud scenarios irrespective of whether virtual machines are hosted on a cluster?

a.option: Live migration and live storage migration

q:
In Windows, which of the following interfaces provides a service that enables users and computers to obtain certificate enrollment policy information in either of the following scenarios:

  • When a computer is not a member of the domain
  • A domain-joined computer is temporarily outside the security boundary of the corporate network
In Windows, which of the following statements about the Certificate Enrollment Control is correct?

a.option: It can be used by an application that makes a request to issue a certificate to a named subject.
It is designed to accept data in the form of a binary string.
The output from the Certificate Enrollment Control is a PKCS #10 certificate request that can be sent to a certification authority.

q: In Windows, if you are interacting with the Intermediary subsystem of the certification system, then which of the following interfaces provides the functionality for retrieving the public configuration data, which is specified during client setup, for the Certificate Services server?

In Windows, the Converged Network Interface Card is a cloud scale fundamental. Which of the following statements about this fundamental are correct:

  1. It allows you to use a single network adapter for management and Remote Direct Memory Access enabled storage.
  2. It cannot handle tenant traffic.
  3. It reduces the capital expenditures that are associated with each server in a datacenter.
In Windows, what are the prerequisites of installing SPA Console?

a.option: SQL Server 2008 R2 Express SP1 or Microsoft SQL Server 2008 R2 SP1

q: In Windows, if you are downloading the Server Performance Advisor for the x64 version, then which of the following commands will you use to extract the files in the CAB file?
In Windows, which of the following packs analyzes the performance of general operating system functions independent of specialized server roles?

In Windows, which of the following tasks are performed by the Server Performance Advisor framework:

  1. Collecting data that is designated by the advisor packs
  2. Writing the collected data into a Microsoft SQL Server database
  3. Creating an IT-friendly environment to run scripts for SPA Advisor Packs
  4. Displaying the final reports
In Windows, what is the "!dae" PSSCOR command used for in the WinDbg debugger?

a.option: Displays all objects in the stack
Shows detailed information about running HttpRuntime (ASP.NET)
Dump all exceptions found in the heap (incl. callstacks)
Save all .NET assemblies to the local disk

q: In Windows, which of these SOS commands is used to display managed call stacks for all threads?
In Windows, which of these WinDbg commands is used to display the time consumption per thread?

In Windows, which of these are features of the WinDbg debugger:

  1. User-mode debugging
  2. Kernel/Remote debugging
  3. Post-mortem debugging

In Windows, which of these are functions of the WinDbg debugger:

  1. It can view the source code and set breakpoints.
  2. It can view variables (including C++ objects).
  3. It can stack traces and memory.

You are configuring the security vulnerabilities in the Windows debugger. Which of the following conditions monitoring the security problems during kernel-mode debugging are correct:

  1. If you use destructive extension DLLs, they can cause your debugger to affect the target computer.
  2. Destructive symbol files can influence your debugger to affect the host computer.
  3. If you are running a remote debugging session, an unexpected client might attempt to link to your server.

In Windows, which of the following statements about Kernel Debugging Control (KDBCtrl) are correct:

  1. It is used to control the kernel debugging connection from the host computer.
  2. It can control five settings namely Full Kernel Debugging, Automatic Kernel Debugging, User-Mode Error Handling, Blocking of Kernel Debugging, and the size of the DbgPrint buffer.
  3. Kernel debugging in the boot settings of the target computer must be enabled before the last boot to use this control.

In Windows, you are configuring the tools.ini file while setting up kernel-mode debugging. Which of the following statements about the col_mode:flag entry in this file are correct:

  1. This entry is used to control the color mode setting.
  2. When the color mode is enabled, the debugger can produce colored output.
  3. By default, most colors are set to the values of RGB.

In Windows, you are configuring the tools.ini file while setting up kernel-mode debugging. Which of the following statements about the entries of this file are correct:

  1. The srcpath:options entry is used to set the source line options that control source display and program stepping options.
  2. The srcpath:directory entry is used to set the source file search path.
  3. The enable_unicode:flag entry specifies whether the debugger displays USHORT pointers and arrays as Unicode strings.
  4. The force_entry_output:flag entry specifies whether integers are displayed in decimal format or in the default radix.
In Windows, you are configuring the tools.ini file while setting up kernel-mode debugging. What is the command-line equivalent for the StopOnProcessExit:flag entry?
In Windows, you are configuring the tools.ini file while setting up kernel-mode debugging. Which of the following statements about the entry sxd: event sxe: event is correct?

a.option: It sets the debugger response and the handling status for the specified exception or event.
It stores the debugger response and the handling status for the debugging event.

q: In Windows, you are configuring the tools.ini file while setting up kernel-mode debugging. What is the command-line equivalent for the entry named StopFirst:flag?

In Windows, you are configuring the tools.ini file while setting up kernel-mode debugging. Which of the following statements about the various entries in this file are correct:

  1. The command-line equivalent for the entry DebugOutput:flag is -o.
  2. The command-line equivalent for the entry IniFile:file is -cf.
  3. The command-line equivalent for the entry LazyLoad:flag is -s.
  4. The command-line equivalent for the entry SetDll:filename is -a.

In Windows, you are configuring the tools.ini file. This file contains information to initialize command-line debuggers. If an entry named DebugChildren:flag from this file is flagged to True, then which of the following debugging environments is used to debug the specified application as well as any child processes?
In Windows, you are setting up the KDNET Network Kernel Debugging automatically. What is the recommended port range for networking debugging?

In Windows, you are setting up KDNET Network Kernel Debugging automatically. If you are required to start a WinDbg session in the host computer, then which of the following Windows console code is used in the command prompt in this scenario?

Which of the following statements about the Microsoft Console Debugger (CDB) environment are correct:

  1. It enables low-level analysis of the Windows user-mode memory and constructs.
  2. It is used for debugging both console applications and graphical Windows programs.
  3. It can analyze binary code by assembling the code and displaying assembly instructions.
  4. It supports the debugging of multiple threads and processes.

Which of the following statements about the Microsoft Kernel Debugger (KD) environment are correct:

  1. It is a character-based console program that enables an in-depth analysis of kernel-mode activity on all CDB-based operating systems.
  2. It is used to debug kernel-mode components and drivers.

Which of the following statements about the Windows Debugger (WinDbg) environment are correct:

  1. It is a Windows-based debugger that is capable of special kernel-mode debugging operations.
  2. It provides debugging for the Windows kernel, kernel-mode drivers, and system services.
  3. It uses the Visual Studio debug symbol formats for source-level debugging.
  4. It can access the name of any public function that is exposed by modules that were compiled with COFF symbol files.

You are working with Windows debugger (WinDbg). Which of the following statements about the kernel mode are correct:

  1. The operating system and privileged programs run in the processor-access mode.
  2. Its code has permission to access a requested part of the system.
  3. Much of the core OS functionality and many hardware device drivers run in kernel mode.

In Windows, which of the following statements about the PowerShell regular expression are correct:

  1. (?>re) is a subexpression that is used to match the independent pattern without backtracking.
  2. [^...] is a subexpression that is used to match a single character that is not available in brackets.
  3. re+ is a subexpression that is used to match one or more of the previous thing.
  4. ^ is a subexpression that is used to match a single character in brackets.

In Windows, which of the following statements about PowerShell variables are correct:

  1. $_ contains the current object in the pipeline object.
  2. $? represents the first token in the last line received by the session.
  3. $$ represents the last token in the last line received by the session.
  4. $PSSCRIPTROOT represents the directory from which a script is being run.

In Windows PowerShell, which of these statements about the following PowerShell code is correct:

Start-Sleep -m 500

a.option: The PowerShell console skips execution for 500 milliseconds.
The PowerShell console resumes after 500 milliseconds.
The PowerShell console skips execution for 500 microseconds.
The PowerShell console resumes after 500 microseconds.

q: In Windows PowerShell, which of the following cmdlets is used to read a CSV file?
In Windows PowerShell, which of the following cmdlets is used to retrieve the content of a file as an array?
In Windows PowerShell, which of the following cmdlets is used to copy a folder?

In Windows PowerShell, which of the following statements about the Command lets (Cmdlets) are correct:

  1. Cmdlets are .NET framework class objects.
  2. They are used to handle parsing, error presentation, and output formatting.
  3. Their process works on objects, not on text stream, and objects can be passed as output for pipelining.

In Windows PowerShell, which of the following statements about the Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE) are correct:

  1. It is a virtual application for Windows PowerShell.
  2. It is used to run commands and write, test, and debug scripts in multiple Windows-based GUIs.

In Windows, which of the following features are added to Microsoft 365 for enterprise to form a cloud-based service named Microsoft Managed Desktop:

  1. End-user device deployment
  2. End-user support

You are working with the Microsoft 365 Compliance. Insider risk-management is a solution in Microsoft 365 that helps minimize internal risks by enabling you to detect, investigate, and take action on risky activities in your organization.

Which of the following principles provides insights to enable employee notifications, data investigations, and employee investigations?
You are working with the Microsoft 365 for Campaigns. If you are required to set Office 365 on your iPhone and Android devices, then which of the following practices must be followed?

a.option: Set up devices to use multi-factor authentication with the authenticator app.
Use Microsoft mobile apps, including Outlook Mobile, Word, OneDrive, and other Microsoft apps from the app store.
Require a PIN for users to unlock their devices.

q: In Windows, which of the following statements represents the advantages of implementing Microsoft 365 for Campaigns?

a.option: You can depend on trusted business productivity and collaboration tools, such as Outlook, Word, Excel, and other Office products.
You can protect your work files on all of your iOS, Android, and Windows 10 devices with enterprise-grade security.
You can apply extra protection for user accounts and identity.

q:
You are working with Advanced Threat Protection (ATP) in Office 365. It includes an advanced reporting dashboard to monitor your ATP performance.

Which of the following ATP reports brings together information about malicious content and email detected and blocked by Exchange Online Protection (EOP) and Office 365 ATP?

You are working with the Microsoft 365 Security. Which of the following categories of malware gathers your personal information, such as sign-in information and personal data, and sends it back to its author?

You are working with Microsoft 365 Security. Ransomware is one of the major categories of malware that encrypts your data and demands payment to decrypt it.

Which of the following actions will be taken by the anti-malware software protection to countermeasure such an attack?

a.option: It removes the file that spreads through your computer or network looking for programs to infect.
It gathers your personal information, such as sign-in information and personal data, and sends it back to its author.
It removes the malware payload that is associated with the attack.

q:
Which of the following foundation-infrastructure deployment strategies of Microsoft 365 for enterprise are valid:

  1. Serial deployment
  2. Top-bottom deployment
  3. Parallel deployment
  4. Up-front deployment

You are deploying the identity infrastructure for Microsoft 365 for enterprise. In what order will you follow these steps to construct your identity infrastructure to ensure that your existing on-premises works with Microsoft 365 for enterprise:

  1. Configure identity governance
  2. Use groups for management
  3. Add the user accounts
  4. Manage user sign-ins
  5. Secure the password
  6. Protect global admin accounts

You are deploying the networking infrastructure for Microsoft 365 for enterprise. Which of the following statements about network hairpins are correct:

  1. It happens when traffic bound for a destination is first directed to another intermediate location.
  2. It is caused by poor routing on the Internet due to network service providers.
  3. It reduces the latency and can potentially redirect traffic to a geographically distant location.

In Windows, you are deploying the networking infrastructure for Microsoft 365 for enterprise. Which of the following steps will you complete to prepare your network for Microsoft 365:

  1. Adjust the network bandwidth for both internal and external links and Internet connections to account for traffic to Microsoft 365 Enterprise cloud services.
  2. Align your network with a Microsoft 365 reference architecture.
  3. After planning the changes, test whether the changes match your bandwidth and traffic latency requirements.

In Windows, you are deploying the networking infrastructure for Microsoft 365 for enterprise. In what order will you follow these steps construct your networking infrastructure for the requirements and capabilities of Microsoft 365 for enterprise:

  1. Avoid network hairpins
  2. Configure traffic bypass
  3. Optimize client and service performance
  4. Configure local internet connections
  5. Prepare the network for Microsoft 365

In Windows, you are deploying the foundation infrastructure of Microsoft 365 for enterprise. If your users and groups are synchronized, then which of the following phases of a defined end-to-end path for deployment is represented in this scenario?
In Windows, if you are required to create a web view, then which of the following UWP properties is used to translate, scale, skew, and rotate it?
Which of the following inking controls in UWP is used to render the pen input either as an ink stroke or an erase stroke?

In Windows, you are working with the Image and ImageBrush classes in UWP. The WriteableBitmap class provides an instance of the BitmapSource class.

Which of the following properties of the WriteableBitmap class is used to get access to the direct buffer?

In Windows, which of the following statements about the ImageBrush class in UWP are correct:

  1. It is used when a user implements this class to paint a non-rectangular area such as an ellipse or border with an image.
  2. It is used when a user is required to use a single ImageBrush to paint multiple areas or UIElements with the same image.
  3. This class defines its content as an image that can be optionally stretched and aligned.

In the .NET framework, which of the following statements about the security in Windows Forms are correct:

  1. Code-access security affects all managed code that targets the common language runtime even if that code does not make a single code-access-security permission check.
  2. If the user runs a Windows Forms executable file directly off a Web server or a file share, then the degree of trust granted to the application depends on where the code is available.
  3. When an application runs, it is automatically evaluated and it receives a named permission set from the common language runtime.
In Windows, which of the following interfaces can be used to access the Kerberos authentication client that is implemented as a security support provider (SSP)?
In Windows, what are the major subsystems of an operational certification system?

a.option: Client, Intermediary, Server, and Administrative client

q: In Windows, which of the following is used to route traffic between virtual networks and physical networks including site-to-site VPN connections from your cloud datacenter to your tenants' remote sites?
In Windows, which of the following registry hives is used to collect registry data from Server Performance Advisor Pack?

In Windows Forms, which of the following statements about the Form.FormClosed shutdown event of the main form is correct:

  1. This event occurs after the form has been closed by the methods such as Exit() and Close() of the Application class.
  2. This event is used to prevent a form from closing.
  3. This event is used to perform tasks such as freeing resources used by the form and to save the information entered in the form or to update its parent form.

In Windows Forms, in which order do the startup events of the main form take place when an application starts:

  1. Form.Load
  2. Control.VisibleChanged
  3. Forms.Activated
  4. Forms.Shown
  5. Control.BindingContextChanged
  6. Control.HandleCreated

You have used the FormBorderStyle enumeration to change the appearance of Windows Forms. This enumeration describes the different styles of the form. Which of the following is the default style field of this enumeration?
In Windows Forms, which of the following C# syntax is used resize a form to 500 x 500 pixels?
In Windows Forms, you are working on creating event handlers. Which of the following keywords is used to connect multiple events to a single event handler using the Visual Basic code editor?

In Windows Forms, which of the following statements about Client Coordinates are correct:

  1. The origin of client coordinates is the upper-left corner of the client area of the control or form.
  2. These coordinates ensure that an application can use consistent coordinate values while drawing in a form or control.
  3. The dimensions of the client area are also described by a rectangular structure that contains both the screen coordinates and the client coordinates of the area.
  4. Graphics operations do not include the right and lower edges of a client area.

In Windows Forms, which of the following statements about Screen Coordinates is correct:

  1. The origin is the upper-right corner of the screen.
  2. The full position of a window is often described by a square structure.

Which of the following statements about the Windows Forms Coordinates are correct:

  1. The basic unit of measure when drawing in Windows Forms is the device unit.
  2. Points on the screen are described by x-coordinate and y-coordinate pairs, with the x-coordinates increasing from right to left and the y-coordinates increasing from top to bottom.
  3. The location of the origin, relative to the screen, varies depending on whether the screen or the client coordinates are specified.

Which of the following statements about Windows forms are correct:

  1. Window forms comprise a set of managed libraries that simplify common application tasks such as reading and writing to the file system.
  2. A form is a visual surface on which you display information for a user.
  3. When a user implements anything to your form or one of its controls, the event generates an action.

You are working on animations in XAML in the Universal Windows Platform (UWP). Easing functions allow you to apply custom mathematical formulas to your animations.

Which of the following statements about the CubeEase easing function are correct:

  1. The ClearValue(DependencyProperty) method returns the current effective value of a dependency property from the class DependencyProperty.
  2. The ReadLocalValue(DependencyProperty) method returns the local value of a dependency property.
  3. The GetAnimationBaseValue(DependencyProperty) method returns any base value established for a dependency property, which would apply in cases where animation is not active.
  4. The Ease(Double) method transforms normalized time to control the pace of an animation.

While working on the icons on the Universal Windows Platform (UWP), you are using the Reveal Focus lighting effect for the device family Windows.xbox. This lighting effect is turned off by default. Which of the following C# syntax can be used to enable this effect:

Syntax 1

if(AnalyticsInfo.VersionInfo.DeviceFamily == "Windows.Xbox")
                {
                                this.FocusVisualKind = FocusVisualKind.Reveal;
                }

Syntax 2

if(AnalyticsInfo.DeviceFamily == "Windows.Xbox")
                {
                                this.FocusVisualKind = FocusVisualKind.View;
                }

Syntax 3

if(AnalyticsInfo.VersionInfo.DeviceFamily == "Windows.Xbox")
                {
                                this.FocusVisualReveal = FocusVisualKind.View;
                }

You are working on media control in the Universal Windows Platform (UWP). The SystemMediaTransportControls class represents an object that enables integration between the system media transport controls and support for media commands. You are required to set the value that specifies whether the channel down button is supported.

Which of the following properties of this class is used to perform this action?

  1. You click the CloseButton button
  2. You press the system back button
  3. You press Alt+F4 on the keyboard
  4. You press Gamepad B
You are working on the Tree view on the Universal Windows Platform (UWP). Which of the following Tree view items is used to get the TreeViewItem container for a specific data item?

If you are required to update the value of the slider control by sliding it, then which of the following parameters must be followed to perform this action?
You are working on the Universal Windows Platform (UWP) to develop a Windows application. What is the required breakpoint range of a medium-sized device for deployment?

You are working on the Universal Windows Platform (UWP) to develop a Windows application. Which of the following recommendations must be followed when you are deploying your application on a smaller device:

  1. Set left and right window margins to 24px to create a visual separation between the left and right edges of the app window.
  2. Use one column/region at a time.
  3. If you're using the master details pattern, use the stacked presentation mode to save screen space.
In Windows, how many w3wp.exe instances are created with respect to application pools?

a.option: One instance for each application in an application pool
One instance for each application pool
At least one instance for each application pool
One instance in total for all application pools

q: If your computer has Microsoft DCS 1.0 runtime installed in it, then which of the following types of installation systems must be used for DCS SP1?
In Windows, an HTTP request for a resource is initiated by a client browser on a web server. Which of the following processes occurs after the HTTP.sys listener intercepts the request?

a.option: HTTP.sys contacts WAS to obtain information
WAS requests configuration information from the configuration store
WAS starts a worker process for the application pool to which the request was made

q: In Windows, you are given two RPC calls. Which of the following components will you use to know or maintain the state of the server?
In the Windows XP system, which of the following levels of permissions must be used to configure a word document that is copied into the shared documents folder?

Your Windows system is infected with viruses or other malware. Which of the following Sysinternal tools cannot be used to solve issues of your infected system:

  1. Sigcheck
  2. Process Explorer
  3. Process Monitor

In Windows, you are given a list of users in a list variable. Which of the following constructs must be used with a script to change the Active Directory settings for every name that is available in the list?

If there are no syntax errors, then what is the output of the following Windows Powershell code:

$n = 1 
Do {

$n = $n + 1

Write-Host ""$n""

} While ($n –lt 2)

The following message is received for the provided pop-up notification while booting a Windows system. Which of the following must be used to resolve this issue:

Message

The Windows Boot Configuration Data file is missing required information

Popup

File: \Boot\BCD
Status: 0xc0000034

a.option: Repair the BCD store by using the bcdedit.exe command
Repair the BCD store by using the bootrec.exe tool
Repair the BCD store by using the startup repair disk

q:
Which of these justifies the occurrence of the following BSOD error code in a Windows system:

STOP 0x00000050 or PAGE_FAULT_IN_NONPAGED_AREA

In Windows, which of the following systems is required for the effective functioning of the authentication system that is contained in the distributed control system:

  1. Active Directory services
  2. WINS

  1. SysmonDrv
  2. Sysmon as command-line tools
  3. Sysmon as a service

  1. Loaded DLLs
  2. Memory-mapped files that were loaded
  3. Handles that were opened

  1. Processed images are recorded as hashes
  2. It provides detailed analyses of events that it generates
  3. It is capable of logging into a network connection

a.option: By using the Sysinternals live service
By using a demo version of the tool

q:
You installed an application that was released in March 2017 on a Windows system in the month of May 2017. You are unable to run the application because of the device driver issues, specifically with GPU. Which of the following actions can be used to fix this issue if the device driver was released in April 2017:

  1. Rollback the driver to before March 2017
  2. Update the driver to one that was released on or after May 2017

a.option: Software driver does not require the PnP support

q:
Which of the following boot phases does not allow you to use the Windows performance toolkit to identify issues:

  1. OS loader
  2. Kernel initialization
  3. Session initialization
  4. Winlogon initialization

There is a set of Windows 7 computers that are connected to an Active Directory domain. Which of the following issues is causing the computers to experience Windows boot delay time for the users:

  1. Hardware performance issues
  2. Network performance issues
  3. Administrator configured workload issues

  2. Replace the original passowrd with the incorrect one
  3. Lock the account on the PDC emulator
  4. Forward the authentication failure to the PDC emulator before an incorrect password failure message is reported to the user

Which of the following phases in a traditional Windows Boot sequence is conducts the following actions:

  1. Determine the amount of available memory
  2. Verify that the boot device is available

  1. Hardware faults cause the driver to be reset 
  2. User is notified by a pop-up notification
  3. Blue screen errors

2017-04-16 10:00:00 ALLOW TCP 192.168.0.106 192.168.0.107 5200 23

It is blocked by the firewall

In Windows, which of the following is not a core component of the DCS architecture?
Which of the following development models is provided by Windows DCS?

  1. Deletion of some files
  2. Transfer ownership of some files to a different user
  3. Log in as an administrator and increase the Disk Quota Allowance
What is the maximum number of volumes that is available within a single Windows partition?
In Windows, a basic disk utilizes the MBR partition scheme. What is the maximum number of partitions that can be available on the disk?
Which of the following partition styles must be utilized by the user while installing a 3TB hard drive on a Windows system?
In Windows, which of the following phases allows the detection of a valid system disk?
In Windows, which of the following functions cannot be performed by the domain naming master FSMO role holder?

a.option: Add or remove a domain from the directory.
Process updates to the directory schema.
Add or remove cross references to domains in external directories.
Make changes to the forest-wide domain name space of the directory.

q:
In Windows, which of the following statements is valid with respect to the directory properties of a Data Collector Set:

  1. You can set a single root directory.
  2. You can set a single root directory and a single subdirectory.
  3. You can set a single root directory and multiple subdirectories.

a.option: Reporting components of OS or applications

q: Which of the following statements about the Directory Services Restore Mode (DSRM) is correct?

a.option: A forgotten DSRM password cannot be recovered later.
By default, a DSRM administrator account is not required to start a domain controller in DSRM to log in.
It is not possible to restart the domain controller remotely in DSRM.
The DSRM allows an administrator to repair or restore the Active Directory database.

a.option: They are used to make the most effective use of space and reduce the need to navigate.
They are used to take advantage of the devices' capabilities.

Yes, but it can be extended to an entire Active Directory forest

q: In Windows, what are the advantages that the Datacenter Firewall provides to cloud service providers?

a.option: It is a highly scalable, manageable, and diagnosable software-based firewall solution that can be offered to tenants.

The firewall rules are configured in each vSwitch port irrespective of the actual host running the virtual machine.
